meanings.definition: To handle or manage too much or too many things.
meanings.sent1: She overhandles her workload and ends up feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: He often overhandles the groceries, trying to carry too many bags at once.
meanings.sent3: The toddler overhandles the toys, creating a mess all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The teacher overhandles the classroom, micromanaging every little detail.
meanings.sent5: The chef overhandles the dough, resulting in tough bread.

meanings.definition: To have excessive control or influence over something.
meanings.sent1: The dictator overhandles the country, suppressing any opposing voices.
meanings.sent2: The manager overhandles the project, not allowing any input from the team.
meanings.sent3: The cat overhandles the mouse toy, claiming it as her own.
meanings.sent4: The CEO overhandles the decision-making process, leaving no room for discussion.
meanings.sent5: The bully overhandles the situation, making everyone feel powerless.

meanings.definition: To deal with or address a situation in an excessive or overbearing manner.
meanings.sent1: She overhandles conflicts, always escalating them into major arguments.
meanings.sent2: The politician overhandles the criticism, responding aggressively to every comment.
meanings.sent3: The customer overhandles the complaint, demanding unrealistic compensation.
meanings.sent4: The coach overhandles the losses, putting too much pressure on the team.
meanings.sent5: The parent overhandles the curfew, making strict rules without flexibility.
